alert.note: Alert for Perry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:42PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Perry and south central Bibb Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 441 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Heiberger, or 10 miles south of Brent. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sprott, Ellards and Oakmulgee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
